intro: Fibigia rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated fibigia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Fibigia rostrata thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticulturists and botanists.
